context: I misquoted the price for our services
letters:
Hey [Client's Name],

I hope this message finds you well! I wanted to take a moment to reach out and sincerely apologize for the mix-up with the pricing I provided for our services. I realize that I misquoted the amount, and I completely understand how frustrating that can be.

I truly appreciate your patience as we sort this out. Please rest assured that I’m here to make it right and ensure we get everything back on track. If there’s anything specific you’d like to discuss or clarify, just let me know, and I’ll be more than happy to help!

Thanks for your understanding, and I look forward to continuing our collaboration.

Best,  
[Your Name]

Dear [Client's Name],

I hope this note finds you in good spirits, possibly sipping a delightful beverage that costs less than I mistakenly quoted for our services!

I want to extend my sincerest apologies for the mix-up regarding the pricing. It seems I got a little too carried away—like a kid in a candy store, but with numbers instead of gummy bears. Instead of providing you with the sweet deal we agreed upon, I managed to throw in a few extra zeroes that should not have been there. Who knew numbers could be as tricky as a cat at a dog show?

Rest assured, I’m on it! I’ve consulted with my calculator, and we’ve come to a mutual understanding: I’ll stick to what was originally quoted, and it won’t involve any surprise pop quizzes on math. 

Thank you for your understanding and patience. You’re a valued client, and I promise to keep my mathematical gymnastics for my own amusement from now on. If you have any lingering questions or if you’d like to talk about these delightful services (at the correct price, I assure you), just let me know!

Sincerely,  
[Your Name]  
[Your Company]

It is always my intention to provide clear and accurate information to my clients, and I understand how important this aspect of our relationship is. I recognize that financial considerations can deeply impact your decisions, and I am truly sorry for any disruption my mistake may have caused.

Please know that I am taking steps to ensure that this does not happen again in the future. Transparency and trust are the foundation of my work, and I greatly value your partnership. If there is anything I can do to rectify this situation or regain your trust, please do not hesitate to let me know. 

Thank you for your understanding and patience as we work through this. I truly appreciate your continued support and look forward to serving you better in the future.

Warm regards,
